etymology.interpretation: 䰜(䰜) (lì, "cauldron") is an ancient form of 鬲(鬲) (lì, "cauldron"), both representing a cooking vessel made from pottery. The character originally depicted the shape of a cauldron and continues to hold this meaning as a historical form.

examples.chinese: 古代祭祀时常用䰜(古代祭祀時常用䰜)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài jìsì shí cháng yòng lì.
examples.english: In ancient rites, cauldrons were commonly used.

examples.chinese: 王羲之参观博物馆(王羲之參觀博物館)，见到展出的古代䰜(見到展出的古代䰜)。
examples.pinyin: Wáng Xīzhī cānguān bówùguǎn, jiàn dào zhǎn chū de gǔdài lì.
examples.english: Wáng Xīzhī visited the museum and saw an ancient cauldron on display.
